item.title: Sun Of The Sleepless - To The Elements
item.subtitle: July 21, 2017
item.body: “Originally formed as an ambient/black metal project in 1999 before evolving into an experimental act that incorporated electronic and trip hop, Sun of the Sleepless released two EP’s and a split before being put to rest in 2005. Twelve years later, Schwadorf has resurrected the project and put out a new full length titled ‘To the Elements’ which feels like a natural continuation of the band’s previous efforts that also pushes it forward into new directions.„

item.title: Fleet Foxes - Crack-Up
item.subtitle: June 16, 2017
item.body: “The album title references a trilogy of essays called The Crack-Up, written by F. Scott Fitzgerald... Crack-Up is filled with similarly satisfying moments, and though they may take several listens to reveal their beauty, the payoff for your patience and attention is substantial„

item.title: Alt-J (∆) - Relaxer
item.subtitle: June 2, 2017
item.body: “With only eight songs coming in at 39 minutes, Relaxer is the band’s shortest album yet. However, this brevity does not lead to a tightly focused record. Each track sees the band trying on a different suit, a scattered approach that finds varying degrees of success. „

item.title: Twin Oaks - Collapse
item.subtitle: June 2, 2017
item.body: “So the EP is themes on the idea of moving on and forgiving. It’s based on the concept of burning down the past, letting go of the idealistic future and living in the present.„

item.title: Novo Amor - Bathing Beach EP
item.subtitle: May 26, 2017
item.body: “Although Bathing Beach’s structure and progression feels logical and intended, so do dreams. And yet, whilst each song follows a familiar formula of subtle builds, unwinding passages, and unhurried climaxes, the album is often amorphous and exciting, simply lovely.„

item.title: Forest Swords - Compassion
item.subtitle: May 5, 2017
item.body: “Overall, this is a dazzling and unique album that often veers from reassuring to disconcerting in the space of a single track.„

item.title: The Afghan Whigs - In Spades
item.subtitle: May 5, 2017
item.body: “Drop the listener off anywhere during In Spades, and they’ll soon know the type of world they’re wandering through. „

item.title: Low Roar - Once in a Long, Long While
item.subtitle: April 11, 2017
item.body: “Once in a Long, Long While was created amid the wreckage of a relationship, with the singer leaving Iceland, spending time in Sweden, and then eventually decamping to Poland. Karazija channelled his emotions into songs. And now that he’s started revisiting those on the road, things are sometimes more painful than he remembers.„

item.title: Timber Timbre - Sincerely, Future Pollution
item.subtitle: April 7, 2017
item.body: “Sincerely, Future Pollution will be released April 7, 2017, on City Slang and Arts & Crafts in Canada. The first single and video "Sewer Blues" is out now. The album will be available on deluxe vinyl, standard vinyl, compact disc, and digital formats. The deluxe limited edition comes on 180gram clear vinyl in a gatefold jacket with tip-on cover and foil print. Europe and North America tour dates announced, on sale January 19.„

item.title: Raoul Vignal - The Silver Veil
item.subtitle: April 6, 2017
item.body: “Vignal sings in long slow exhales but his fingers dance restlessly upon his guitar strings, lending an undercurrent of anxiety to his delicate acoustic compositions. The rhythmic thrum of his bass notes resonate like the low rumble of wind.„

item.title: Hauschka - What If
item.subtitle: March 31, 2017
item.body: “For his new album, which he describes as his 'most radical,' Bertelmann moves beyond his usual piano treatments to bring in vintage synthesizers, noise, and experiments with manipulated player pianos.„

item.title: Saltland - A Common Truth
item.subtitle: March 31, 2017
item.body: “Saltland is the solo project of Rebecca Foon (Thee Silver Mt Zion, Esmerine, Set Fire To Flames). A Common Truth is Saltland's second full-length album.„

item.title: Ono Scream - Ono Scream
item.subtitle: March 28, 2017
item.body: “The solo project of Belgium band Apparaat’s frontman Bart Willems, Ono Scream is heavily influenced by Willem’s childhood influences such as Bauhaus and early Simple Minds. A nod to Joy Division would be hard to ignore, especially considering the album was released by French label Unknown Pleasures Records, but this album is no hackneyed tribute to the legends of the heyday.„

item.title: Nyctalgia - A Hint of Eternity
item.subtitle: March 20, 2017
item.body: “Displaying great and diversified technical abilities, supported by the infinite amplitude of possibilities allowed by the genre, Nyctalgia creates in the apex of its musical sensibilities a universe of simplified allegories that translates music into human feelings.„

item.title: Cigarettes After Sex - Cigarettes After Sex LP
item.subtitle: March 15, 2017

item.title: Laura Marling - Semper Femina
item.subtitle: March 10, 2017
item.body: “It is beautiful, intimate, and ultimately very frightening to be what you love. It’s not hard to understand Marling’s initial hesitance in how to approach an album about women: To a woman, other women both are and are not oneself. To embrace a love, respect, and idolatry of the feminine means, as Marling notes, to come to a place of empathy and self-love, and these are things that can make you feel as naked and vulnerable as sex can.„

item.title: Shannon Wright - Division
item.subtitle: February 24, 2017
item.body: “Whether she’s whispering pleas for relief or howling away demons, Wright’s songs mainline into dread, confusion and division but emerge from their trials graced by beauty.„

item.title: Peter Silberman - Impermanence
item.subtitle: February 24,2017
item.body: “Much of what distinguishes Impermanence from its forebears can be attributed to an unexpected injury, which forced me to consider the finite. A few years ago, I developed a hearing impairment that resulted in a temporary total hearing loss in one ear and an excruciating sensitivity to everyday sounds, including my own voice. In order to find rest and quiet, I left my Brooklyn apartment for a secluded setting in upstate New York.„

item.title: Autism - Film Noir
item.subtitle: February 20, 2017
item.body: “Film Noir is a major improvement over the band’s previous efforts. To be sure, it’s a culmination but with a level of maturity that is astounding and particularly so from a band that’s only been active since 2012. If you must tag it, this album fits in with post rock and metal but there’s so much more on offer here and so much to take in that multiple listens slowly peel each layer like an exotic fruit.„

item.title: The Maledictions - Bury Me Sweet Ghost
item.subtitle: February 7, 2017

item.title: Nadine Khouri - The Salted Air
item.subtitle: February 3, 2017
item.body: “Khouri writes that the The Salted Air is an album that deals 'with themes of loss and transformation,' and 'the desire to trace a trajectory back to an “original” state of being or presence.'„

item.title: Flo Morrissey and Matthew E. White - Gentlewoman, Ruby Man
item.subtitle: January 13, 2017
item.body: “Morrissey and White first met in person at a Lee Hazelwood tribute at the Barbican in the autumn of 2015. They sang Some Velvet Morning, solidified a correspondence into a friendship and discussed a desire to work together in the near future. That desire grew into Gentlewoman, Ruby Man, in some ways a straightforward duets record, of a kind that has fallen out of fashion: two separate entities meeting to record a collection of great songs as a one-off, Marvin & Tammi-style.„
